definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out

sentences.english: On the grounds of modern emergency medicine, defibrillation has to be performed in combination with CPR.
sentences.chinese: 根據現代急救理念，電除顫必須與心肺復甦聯合應用。

sentences.english: To assess the effectiveness of cardiac compressions during adult cardiopulmonary resuscitation, the nurse should palpate which pulse site?
sentences.chinese: 心肺復甦時，評估按壓的有效性，應檢查哪處的脈搏？

sentences.english: The cells were passaged by mechanical methods, frozen and thawed by general procedure.
sentences.chinese: 採用機械方法傳代，常規方法凍存和復甦。

sentences.english: S. demand for foreign goods will rebound with the economy.
sentences.chinese: 隨着經濟的復甦，美國對外國產品的需求也會反彈。

sentences.english: Still, a recovery strategy dependent on reinflating an asset bubble is fraught with risks.
sentences.chinese: 不過，依靠再次創造資產泡沫的復甦策略充滿了風險。

sentences.english: B. The stock market shows signs of recovery.
sentences.chinese: 股市顯示出復甦的跡象。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the control system of a novel double-pump resuscitation(DPR) instrument.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹一種新型雙泵復甦裝置的控制系統。

sentences.english: I don't see a double dip... The recovery is on track.
sentences.chinese: 我不覺得是雙谷衰退，經濟復甦已經走上正軌。

sentences.english: However, the pace and timing of the recovery is still highly uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 然而，復甦的速度和時間仍然是十分不確定的。

sentences.english: Resuscitating an 89-year-old woman was difficult but well worth it.
sentences.chinese: 使89歲的老婦復甦艱難，但非常值得。

sentences.english: They also saw the need to explore new options for energizing the rebound.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到了爲深化經濟復甦探索新方法的需要。

sentences.english: The spring snow melt, all things recovery, 10000 Purple Yan-hong, to give hope.
sentences.chinese: 春天冰雪融化，萬物復甦，萬紫嫣紅，給人們希望。

sentences.english: Such a frugal mind-set could take the edge off any recovery.
sentences.chinese: 而這樣的節約心態將會減弱復甦進度。

sentences.english: Spring rains and warm sunlight quickened the earth.
sentences.chinese: 春雨和溫暖的陽光使大地復甦了。

sentences.english: Banks need to be recapitalized for the recovery process to begin.
sentences.chinese: 銀行要重新注資，以啓動復甦進程。

sentences.english: Yet it is hard to believe that economic recovery and the debate over political reform cannot continue on parallel tracks.
sentences.chinese: 然而，政制改革和經濟復甦是可以同時進行的。

definition: variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to improve/to take a turn for the better/improvement
expansion/dilation/to expand (e.g. one's power or influence)/to broaden
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
